title: Public Records Request

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to a press release on April 12, 2021, the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation, in coordination with the Tennessee Department of Safety and Homeland Security, contracted to deploy CopLinkX software from Forensic Logic: https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/tennessee-to-deploy-forensic-logic-s-coplink-x-law-enforcement-information-sharing-platform-statewide-1030295108

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current operating manuals, user guides, and training materials for the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation's use of CopLink software.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with e.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Mr. Hoover,

This email is in response to your public records request, received on February 17, 2023, for the following: “All current operating manuals, user guides, and training materials for the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation's use of CopLink software.”  Please find attached records responsive to your request.  This includes training materials generated by the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation.

To the extent your request encompasses training materials developed by Forensic Logic, please be informed that we are restricted from providing such records pursuant to federal copyright laws.  Likewise, while user guides are developed and maintained by Forensic Logic, we would be unable to provide said records under federal copyright laws.

Accordingly, your request is respectfully denied, in part.

Thank you,

[Description: TBI_Seal_Vector_Color]
Tennessee Bureau of Investigation
Professional Standards Unit
901 R.S. Gass Boulevard
Nashville, TN 37216

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Greta Moran

communications.subject: NC Dept of Labor Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Greta Moran
MuckRock News, DEPT MR131353
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, Massachusetts. 02115
131353-61094228@requests.muckrock.com<mailto:131353-61094228@requests.muckrock.com>

Ms. Moran,
You submitted a public records request to the NC Department of Labor on 07/13/2022 regarding Occupational Safety and Health inspections performed on Lorillard, Inc., Alliance One International., Reynolds American Inc., Liggett Vector Brands LLC, and Imperial Tobacco PLC.
It is my understanding that you have been provided the OSH inspection information from PSIM, but an additional part of your requests was "all of the agency's e-mail correspondences with any of the follow tobacco companies, Lorillard, Inc., Alliance One International., Reynolds American Inc., Liggett Vector Brands LLC. Imperial Tobacco PLC, between January 1, 2020 and present."  Based on what you have requested, I have to run email searches separate from the OSH inspection information because emails are maintained in a separate system. Due to the sensitive nature of emails, I am the only authorized person within the agency with all email access who may run such a search.
To date, I have attempted to run the requested company names in a myriad of ways, but because of the commonality of several words  (e.g., alliance, brands, tobacco) and your request for "all of the agency's email correspondence" (no specific NC Dept of Labor employee), I am getting thousands of emails that include those words; further, the search must be run through all 350+ NCDOL employees, so each search is taking several hours to run.  I then have to review the emails to see if the email is applicable to your request, such as only referring to "Alliance One International" instead of some other Alliance One reference.  I have continued to attempt to refine the searches, in an attempt to produce a more reasonable-sized list. Please be advised that based on my prior attempts, I must advise you that it will  take me extensive time to go through such information.
Is there a way you can refine your request or narrow the time frame?  Are there any specific NCDOL employees that may have been corresponding with these companies or are there specific email addresses within those named companies that I could use to refine the search?  Any information would be greatly appreciated.
Thank you.

Jill F. Cramer
General Counsel
NC Department of Labor
Direct: 919-707-7710
Main Legal Affairs: 919-707-7713

Mailing Address:
1101 Mail Service Center
Raleigh, NC   27699-1101

communications.subject: RE: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: E-mail Correspondences with Tobacco Companies (North Carolina Department Of Labor)
communications.communication:
Dear Jill,

Thank you for your time, and thorough consideration, in assisting me with this. I apologize for my delay in replying to your earlier correspondence. 

Would it make your search more feasible if I added in some of the key words that I am looking for? 

I would like to request all of the agency's e-mail correspondences, containing  one or all of the phrases, "heat illness," "extreme heat," "breaks," "Green Tobacco Sickness," "pesticide poisoning,"  with any of the following tobacco companies, Lorillard, Inc., Alliance One International., Reynolds American Inc., Liggett Vector Brands LLC. Imperial Tobacco PLC, between January 1, 2020 and present.

Please let me know if this would help. I'm also happy to discuss other possibilities for refining the request over the phone (917-405-8270), if easier. 

Best
Greta Moran

communications.subject: RE: NC Dept of Labor Public Records Request
communications.communication:
Greta

I am continuing to perform the requested search when feasible.  As previously related, some of the runs to include the tobacco companies name produce thousands of results because of similar names (e.g., Imperial or Reynolds),  even though I run the searches using quotation marks around the company names.  I continue to try different ways to run the searches to produce more reasonable batches through which to search.

As you may know, our agency provides training on green tobacco illness along with other hazards to which agricultural employees may be exposed.

Attached are 3 sets of emails produced from recent searches ("pesticide"; "green tobacco").  You may also want to review the SOAR reports (State OSHA Annual Report) and you may find them here:
SOAR | NC DOL<https://www.labor.nc.gov/document-collection/soar>.  In addition, you may want to review the FAME reports NCDOL makes to federal OSHA. Those reports may be found on the federal OSHA website here:
https://www.osha.gov/stateplans/famereport/NC

Jill F. Cramer
General Counsel
NC Department of Labor
Direct: 919-707-7710
Main Legal Affairs: 919-707-7713

title: MEDCOM NGB

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DOD/Army 1.3.23
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

All contacting records responsive to Shield Analysis Technology LLC and Denise N. Baken (award IDs: W81XWH18C0086, W81XWH22P0109, and and W9133L19C2501). Shield Analysis Technology LLC was awarded contracts between Fiscal Years 2018 and 2022 with the Department of Defense (DOD) through its subsidiary agency, the Department of the Army. This request includes, but is not limited to:

- Current and previous contracts

- Requests for Proposals

- Initial Bid Documents

- Memorandum(s) of Understanding

- Letters of Interest

- Privacy impact assessments

- Invoices

- Change Orders

- Presentations by Shield Analysis Technology LLC or Denise N. Baken

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media, with bylines including Covert Action Magazine, Janata Weekly, and Philly Voice. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

communications.subject: FOIA Received and Redirected FP-23-006393/FA-23-0043
communications.communication:
Good morning Mr. Skvarla,

 

Your FOIA request related for contracts: W81XWH18C0086,W81XWH22P0109, and
W9133L19C2501, was received in the Headquarters - Army Contracting Command
(HQ-ACC) FOIA Office on 3 January 2023.

 

The HQ-ACC FOIA Office is not the record custodian for the information you
requested.  Therefore, your request will be referred to the Organizations
that have purview for the requested information.

 

Contact information for the Medical Command (MEDCOM) and the Army National
Guard Bureau (NGB) FOIA Offices is listed below:

 

MEDCOM (W81XWH18C0086,W81XWH22P0109)

CDR, USAMRDC
ATTN: FCMR-SG
810 Schreider Street
Fort Detrick, MD 21702-5000

 <mailto:USArmy.Detrick.MEDCOM-USAMRMC.mbx.FOIA@health.mil>
USArmy.Detrick.MEDCOM-USAMRMC.mbx.FOIA@health.mil

 

Army National Guard (W9133L19C2501)

NGB FOIA Office (NGB/JA-OIP)

111 South George Mason Drive, AH2

Arlington, VA 22204-1373

ngb.foia@army.mil <mailto:ngb.foia@army.mil> 

 

 

Upon receipt of your request, the MEDCOM and NGB FOIA Offices will advise
you on how they will process this request.  Additionally, they may refer
your request to the appropriate subcomponent to review, make a release
determination, assess fees and provide you with a response. 

 

Please do not hesitate to contact the HQ-ACC FOIA Office if you have any
questions about your FOIA Request.  Also, ensure you include your FOIA case
number when corresponding with the HQ-ACC FOIA Team.

 

 

 

Very Respectfully,

Ms. Sonya D. Moman

Headquarters, Army Contracting Command

FOIA Officer

Email:usarmy.redstone.acc.mbx.hqaccfoia@army.mil

title: Holocaust Survey (Shoreham-wading River Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Holocaust Survey (Shoreham-wading River Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

By way of background, on August 10, 2022, Governor Kathy Hochul signed into law Chapter 490 of the Laws of 2022 requiring a survey regarding instruction on the Holocaust within New York State public school districts. Through the survey, superintendents are required to attest that the district is teaching about the Holocaust appropriately as part of classroom instruction aligned with the NYS Social Studies Learning Standards and §801 of Education Law.

In October 2022, Deputy Commissioner Angelique Johnson-Dingle sent a memo to public school superintendents including a copy of that survey and instructions for accessing and submitting the survey via the SED Monitoring and Vendor Performance System in the NYSED Business Portal.

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request all of the Holocaust Instruction Survey responses submitted since August 10, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: NJDOC Policies and Procedures Regarding Transgender, Intersex and Non-Binary Inmates

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: NJDOC Policies and Procedures Regarding Transgender, Intersex and Non-Binary Inmates
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

* NJ Department of Corrections policies and procedures regarding transgender, intersex and non-binary inmates, revised in October 2023. 
* All correspondence among NJDOC employees regarding revision of Internal Management Procedure PCS.001.TGI.01. 
* All correspondence between DOC Administrator Alfred Kandell Jr and colleagues at the NJDOC, including emails, voicemails, and text messages sent and received on official county devices and accounts, as well those received on private electronic devices, during the period of June 2022 - March 2023. Keywords include: "Transgender," "Demi Minor," "Demi," "Trans." 

I am submitting this request as part of news gathering in my capacity as a journalist at WNYC.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ellie Lightfoot

communications.subject: OPRA 21131
communications.communication:
Dear Requester,

The requested policy is attached.

The Department cannot fulfill the remainder of your request pursuant to MAG Entertainment LLC v. Division of Alcohol Beverage Control, 375 N.J. Super. 534 (App. Div. 2005).  In addition, the Court in MAG a stated, “OPRA is not intended as a research tool litigants may use to force government officials to identify and siphon useful information.  Under OPRA, agencies are required to disclose only identifiable government records not other wise exempt. In short, OPRA does not countenance open-ended searches of an agency’s files.”

You have a right to challenge the decision by the Department of Corrections.  At your option, you may either institute a proceeding in the Superior Court of New Jersey or file a complaint in writing with the Government Records Council (GRC).  You may contact the GRC by toll-free telephone at 866-850-0511, by mail at P.O. Box 819, Trenton, NJ 08625, by e-mail at Government.Records@dca.nj.gov<mailto:Government.Records@dca.nj.gov> or at their web site at www.state.nj.us/grc<http://www.state.nj.us/grc>.  The Council can also answer other questions about the law.


Thank you
John Falvey
NJDOC Records Custodian

title: Public Records Request for Data on School Policing

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Data on School Policing
communications.communication:
To whoever it may concern: 

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, G.L. c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your school district. Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act,  school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE).   DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement.  DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.  

A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”  

A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”   


I request the following public records, as defined in G. L. c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth): 

1.	An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns:
a.	Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement
b.	Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement
c.	Charge (or charges)
d.	Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement
e.	Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
f.	Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
g.	Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
h.	Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
i.	Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
j.	Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school.
k.	Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and 
l.	Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.

2.	If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide school incident reports on each school-related arrest and referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 

3.	A copy of any active standard operating procedures developed with the police department and/or other law enforcement agencies regarding police placement or activity in your corresponding school;  and,

4.	Any records instructing or informing police personnel of, or otherwise describing data reporting requirements and procedures for complying with G.L. c. 71 § 37P(b).

5.	The cost to the school district of assigning a school resource officer to each school; and, 

6.	The total number of school resource officers and total number of guidance counselors for each school in your district for school years 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and,

7.	The total number and a brief description of 911 calls from schools in your district to local police departments conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022, and, 

8.	A description of the proposed budget for mental, social, or emotional health support personnel for the school district.

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act.  “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”    

It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your school district may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty.  Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.
 
Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. G.L.c. 66, § 6A(d). 

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply.  To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety.

If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me by phone at (617)-373-5862 or by email at k.stathulis@northeastern.edu. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.
	
Sincerely, 


Katherine Stathulis, Esq.
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration
Northeastern University School of Law

title: Electronic Message Records

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Electronic Message Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All e-mail sent to or from the following account, deleted or not:

ramey.kyle@oakwoodschools.org

From the dates:

17 August 2021 to 3 November or the date you acknowledge this request,  whichever is later. 

Please preserve records as of the date of this request. 

With the following case insensitive search terms present in any field:

libelous
OR slanderous 
OR misinformation
OR fear 
OR distrust
OR cancelled
OR CRT
OR EDI
OR Rufo
OR Defending
OR transgender
OR gay
OR straight
OR racist 
OR anti racist
OR SEL 
OR social emotional learning
OR School
OR Board
OR election

This request is not over-broad.  It is for a specific search terms,  domain, account, and time frame.

Please redact all student identifiers as required by law,  including parent names when that would identify discussion of students.

Please provide results in text format pdf,  not graphical text pdf

If links or hidden fields are present,  please provide in a format that allows viewing the hidden information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Hal Flak

communications.subject: Re: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Electronic Message Records
communications.communication:
Hal,


I represent Oakwood City Schools, and am acknowledging receipt of your request pursuant to Ohio’s Public Records Act.  Please direct any further communication regarding this request to me.



The request that you have made, because you include the term “school” in the search terms, targets every email to or from the email account ramey.kyle@oakwoodschools.org<mailto:ramey.kyle@oakwoodschools.org>.  This makes your request overly broad, ambiguous and all-encompassing, asking that the District completely duplicate email files.  The Public Records Act does not contemplate that a person is entitled to a “complete duplication” of a public office’s “voluminous files.”  State ex rel. Glasgow v. Jones, 19 Ohio St. 3d 91, 2008-Ohio-4788, 894 N.E.2d 686, at   ¶17; see also, e.g., State ex rel. Bristow v. Baxter, 6th Dist. Erie No. E-17-060, 2018-Ohio-1973.



I am requesting that you revise your request so that it is not overly broad, ambiguous, and all-encompassing.

​

Thank you.


Janet Cooper
Of Counsel
BRICKER & ECKLER LLP
312 N. Patterson Blvd., Suite 200
Dayton, OH   45402
jcooper@bricker.com

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Electronic Message Records
communications.communication:
Thank you for the reply. 

Please delete the term "school".

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Electronic Message Records
communications.communication:
Hal,

Eliminating the term “school” from your request resulted in a substantial reduction in the number of documents that were responsive, as one would suspect since the word “school” appeared in each email sent to or from ramey.kyle@oakwoodschools.org<mailto:ramey.kyle@oakwoodschools.org> for the time period in question.

There is one other search term that I would ask you to consider eliminating, and that is “Board.”  This term appears 1,847 times in the responsive documents, and includes such items as:  “Do you think it is a good idea for our Board Staff to have an opportunity for updated pictures for our ID Card?” and “Sandi has been emailing books in the office for me and then getting a total and then I let them know to send a check made out to the Board of Education.”

Thank you for your consideration of this request.  We anticipate sending the responsive documents to you by the end of next week.

Janet

Janet K. Cooper
Of Counsel
BRICKER & ECKLER LLP
312 N. Patterson Blvd., Suite 200
Dayton, OH   45402

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Electronic Message Records
communications.communication:
Hal,

Documents responsive to your request have been located and reviewed.  With
your agreement, we eliminated the search terms “board” and “school” from
the request. Redactions were made from some of the documents for the
following reasons:

1.       Some of the responsive documents included personally identifiable
student information, protected from disclosure pursuant to the Family
Education Rights and Privacy Act of 1974 (FERPA), Title 20 U.S.C. 122g, and
ORC 3318.321.

2.       Some of the information in responsive documents does not serve to
document the functions or operations of the District as a public office  OR
149.011(G); *State ex rel. Dispatch Printing Co. v. Johnson,*  106 Ohio
St.3d 160 (2005).

3.       Some documents are privileged communications between attorney and
client.  ORC 149.4(A)(1)(v); ORC 2317.02; *State ex rel. Thomas v. Ohio
State Univ.,*  71 Ohio St.3d 245 (1994).

The documents are attached to this email. If you have any questions, please
let me know.

Best regards,
Laura Sauber
 OCS Response 1 (2).pdf
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/12NWh6I8iodksFf1uO3mPzubat6pmHD8U/view?usp=drive_web>

Oakwood, OH 45409

following reasons:

1.       Some of the responsive documents included personally identifiable
student information, protected from disclosure pursuant to the Family
Education Rights and Privacy Act of 1974 (FERPA), Title 20 U.S.C. 122g, and
ORC 3318.321.

2.       Some of the information in responsive documents does not serve to
document the functions or operations of the District as a public office  OR
149.011(G); *State ex rel. Dispatch Printing Co. v. Johnson,*  106 Ohio
St.3d 160 (2005).

3.       Some documents are privileged communications between attorney and
client.  ORC 149.4(A)(1)(v); ORC 2317.02; *State ex rel. Thomas v. Ohio
State Univ.,*  71 Ohio St.3d 245 (1994).

The documents are attached to this email. If you have any questions, please
let me know.

Best regards,
Laura Sauber

title: Police Data Collection Request (2021)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police Data Collection Request (2021)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used in 2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2021, etc.)
 
2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.
 
6. the total number of officer involved shootings in 2021, both fatal and non-fatal.
 
When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.
 
Note that my requests for civilian complaints are specifically for civilian complaints alleging police misconduct, please do not include complaints filed by one officer/the department against another officer.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

  1.  the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used in 2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2021, etc.)

     *   WRAP                                                   44


2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.  12 misconduct complaints, 4 sustained

3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021. 2 Excessive force complaints, 0 sustained

4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.  3 Biased policing reports, 0 sustained

5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.  1 criminal conduct complaint, 0 sustained

Kelly

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: California Public Records Act Request: Police Data Collection Request (2021)
communications.communication:
Hi,
This email is in response to your California Public Records Act requested submitted to the City of Daly City.

Please see the Police Department's responses to your request below:
1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used in 2021 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2021, baton incidents in 2021, etc.)  The Police Department recorded 12

2. the total number of civilian complaints alleging any form of law enforcement misconduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.  The Police Department received 12 Misconduct complaints, of which 4 were Sustained.

3. the total number of civilian complaints alleging law enforcement use of excessive force that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021. The Police Department received 2  Excessive force complaints, of which 0 were Sustained

4. the total number of civilian complaints alleging biased policing or racial profiling that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021.  The Police Department received 3 Biased Policing complaints, of which 0 were Sustained

5. the total number of civilian complaints alleging criminal conduct that were reported and the total number sustained in 2021. The Police Department received 1 Criminal Conduct complaints, of which 0 were Sustained

6. the total number of officer involved shootings in 2021, both fatal and non-fatal.  There were no officer involved shootings in 2021.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thank you,

Kelly

Kelly Schott
Asst. City Attorney
City of Daly City
333 90th Street
Daly City, CA  94015
650-991-8122
kschott@dalycity.org

communications.subject: PRR 2157:  Nevada Public Records Act Request: Nevada Athletics Records
communications.communication:
Hello,

The University does not have a financial report provided to the NCAA that covers the period of August 2022 till February 27, 2023.  The University provides its most recent financial report to the NCAA.

With respect to your requests for ticket sales and attendance, the University requests clarification.  For which sports are you requesting per game attendance and ticket sales?  For which sports are you requesting “per sport” ticket sales and attendance?  Are you seeking the total for each of the listed years?   Last, for which sports are you seeking yearly ticket sales and attendance?


Thank you,

[University of Nevada, Reno logo]<http://www.unr.edu/>

Lewis Beck
Operations Coordinator,
Administration and Finance
Mail stop: 0003

VPAF Office: (775)784-4031<tel:(775)784-4031>
Work Phone: (775)682-9269
lewisbeck@unr.edu<mailto:lewisbeck@unr.edu>

communications.subject: RE: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Nevada Athletics Records
communications.communication:
In regards to ticket sales, I would like to see the ticket sales and attendance records per game for Football, Men's basketball, Women's basketball, and Women's Volleyball. I would like to see the total per game since 2021
For per game ticket sales per year, I would like to see the total per year per sport for Football, Men's basketball, Women's basketball, and Women's Volleyball. I would like to see the total for each of the listed years. 
Thank you for your response and for asking for further clarification. Let me know if anything is still unclear and I will do my best to explain. 
Thank you and I hope to hear from you soon.

title: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – LICENSE PLATE READERS (Riverside County Sheriff)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – LICENSE PLATE READERS (Riverside County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request the following information from your office for the period January 1, 2020 to the date of this letter.

 - Number, if any, of License Plate Readers owned by this department or agency, including the manufacturer and whether a data storage package has been provided by the manufacturer.

 - Any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of License Plate Readers.

 - Any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of License Plate Readers,  including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities.

 - Any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of License Plate Readers.

Please notify me when this information is available.

Thank you for your attention to this request and for your prompt reply within 10 days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Swartz Day Police Surveillance Project

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: C000238-022823
communications.communication:
Dear Aaron Swartz: 
 
Thank you for submitting a request for public records to Riverside County Sheriff's Department. Your request was received in this office on 2/28/2023 and given the reference number C000238-022823 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: " To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request the following information from your office for the period January 1, 2020 to the date of this letter.

- Number, if any, of License Plate Readers owned by this department or agency, including the manufacturer and whether a data storage package has been provided by the manufacturer.

- Any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of License Plate Readers.

- Any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of License Plate Readers, including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities.

- Any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of License Plate Readers.

Please notify me when this information is available.

Thank you for your attention to this request and for your prompt reply within 10 days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Swartz Day Police Surveillance Project

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Friverside-county-sheriff-806%252Fpublic-records-request-license-plate-readers-riverside-county-sheriff-141338%252F%253Femail%253Driversidesheriff%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAwWr1ZYs61CqFE5DkargQADkI%3A1pXC78%3A8NElT2MfF9UReGbwr8NrLh7YZ0T37desQVDe-0Lb49g" 
Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist.  If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt. (Civ. Code § 10.)  You may be contacted by the department if there are questions regarding your request. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: The California Public Records Act (CPRA) does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Records Request System. 
Riverside County Sheriff's Department

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 

RE: Public Records Request of February 28, 2023, Reference # C000238-022823 

Dear Aaron Swartz, 

On February 28, 2023, the Riverside County Sheriff's Department received your request for records under the California Public Records Act (CPRA) wherein you requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

I am writing to request the following information from your office for the period January 1, 2020 to the date of this letter. 
1. Number, if any, of License Plate Readers owned by this department or agency, including the manufacturer and whether a data storage package has been provided by the manufacturer. 

2. Any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of License Plate Readers. 

3. Any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of License Plate Readers, including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities. 

4. Any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of License Plate Readers. 

Please notify me when this information is available. 

Thank you for your attention to this request and for your prompt reply within 10 days. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Aaron Swartz Day Police Surveillance Project 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Friverside-county-sheriff-806%252Fpublic-records-request-license-plate-readers-riverside-county-sheriff-141338%252F%253Femail%253Driversidesheriff%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAwWr1ZYs61CqFE5DkargQADkI%3A1pXC78%3A8NElT2MfF9UReGbwr8NrLh7YZ0T37desQVDe-0Lb49g" 
The above request was numbered for ease of reference. Vigilant ALPR - 32 mobile cameras, 55 fixed cameras, 7 pole cameras. All Vigilant data is stored on Azure Government Cloud Servers.  Flock ALPR - 255 fixed cameras.  All Flock data is stored on Amazon AWS Government Cloud Server Item 1: The Riverside County Sheriff's Department has reviewed your request and has determined that the records requested are exempt from disclosure under the California Public Records Act (CPRA) for the following reasons: Item 2: 
Government Code § 7922.000 – the records in question are exempt because under the facts of the particular case the public interest served by not disclosing the record clearly outweighs the public interest served by disclosure of the record. 
Government Code § 7927.500 provides that preliminary drafts, notes, or interagency or intra-agency memoranda that are not retained by the public agency in the ordinary course of business are exempt from disclosure if the public interest in withholding those records clearly outweighs the public interest in disclosure. Please visit our website at Item 3: www.riversidesheriff.org and click on the Transparency button on the top banner.  Scroll down to Department Manual and Policies and click that button. Scroll down and utilize the link for Department Standards Manual and search for Policy 412. No records exist. Item 4: 
Sincerely, 

Sergeant Justin Pittenger J.D. 
CPRA Unit 
Riverside County Sheriff's Department

title: New York Freedom of Information Act. Request: New York Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (State University of New York at Albany)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York Freedom of Information Act. Request: New York Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (State University of New York at Albany)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { New York Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.subject: Pepsi 2017-2027 agreement  (Muckrock News_Henson)
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Henson:

Thank you for contacting the Freedom of Information Law office at University at Albany. We have found the attached record “UAS-Pepsi Pouring Rights 2017-2027” to be responsive to your request for “A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company”.  The attached agreement has not been cancelled and is still in effect.
Please note that the attached record has been redacted as some of the content is exempt from disclosure under the Public Officers Law Article 6, section 87.2 (d) {Trade Secrets}.

There is no charge for this request. We hope that the attached record will be of good use to you.

Kind regards,

Corinne
Corinne Fauchon |  FOIL Records Access Officer
Office of Enterprise Risk Management and Compliance
University at Albany | State University of New York at Albany [https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/9a/42/c8/9a42c81259d79d0ceaea80c392c3cf4a.jpg]
University Hall 212 | 1400 Washington Avenue | Albany, New York 12222
EMAIL: FOIL@albany.edu<mailto:FOIL@albany.edu> |
You may appeal this determination in part or in whole, in writing, citing any basis consistent with the Public Officers Law for release of the records within (30) days of your receipt hereof to:
Ann Hawkins
FOIL Appeals Officer
The State University of New York
H. Carl McCall SUNY Building – 353 Broadway
 Albany, NY  12246

title: Government Enterprise IT Systems (Information Technology, North Carolina)

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Government Enterprise IT Systems (Information Technology, North Carolina)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

a catalog of all Enterprises Systems, including CRM (Customer Relationship Management, e.g., Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, and Adobe Marketo), ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning, e.g., SAP, Oracle ERP Cloud, and Workday), and iPaaS (Integration Platform as a Service, e.g., Informatica, MuleSoft, SnapLogic, Dell Boomi, and Jitterbit), that are used in all departments, including 311, police, permitting, finance, etc. The catalog contains the current system vendor, system product name, and system's purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ni Xu

title: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – SOCIAL MEDIA MONITORING SOFTWARE (Riverside County Sheriff)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – SOCIAL MEDIA MONITORING SOFTWARE (Riverside County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request the following information from your office for the period January 1, 2020 to the date of this letter.

 - Number, if any, of Social Media Monitoring software packages or service agreements in place with this department or agency. Please specify if software has been purchased or if services are performed by outside contractors for the department or agency.

 - Any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of  Social Media Monitoring software packages or service agreements.

 - Any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of Social Media Monitoring software packages or service agreements. including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities.

 - Any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of Social Media Monitoring Software Packages or Service Contractors.

Please notify me when this information is available.

Thank you for your attention to this request and for your prompt reply within 10 days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Swartz Day Police Surveillance Project

Riverside County Sheriff's Department

title: Death Records  - Imperial County Sheriff’s Office

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Death Records  - Imperial County Sheriff’s Office
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Unidentified Remains Policy Guidance 
Any policy, procedure, manual, guidance document, or post order maintained by the Imperial County Sheriff’s Office regarding identification, documentation, return, or disposal of human remains located within the County limits as described in the Imperial SD Policy Manual (v. 2023/2/01) at page 257 under section 334.2.4 - UNIDENTIFIED DEAD BODIES (available at https://icso.imperialcounty.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/RELEASE_20230201_T161156_Imperial_County_SD_Policy_Manual.pdf). We are seeking any further clarification on ISCO’s process for creating “John Doe” or “Jane Doe” numbers for the Coroner’s case report, as required by Section 334.2.4. Please provide any records of guidance in effect between January 1, 2005 and January 1, 2021. 

2. ICSO John Doe Death Report Records 
Any ICSO document listing by date and/or case number all reports for unidentified dead bodies (“John Doe” or “Jane Doe” reports) created by ICSO in concert with the Coroner’s Office pursuant ICSO Policy 334.2.4 between January 1, 2005 - January 1, 2021. If these records could be produced in the form of a single spreadsheet, we would accept that in lieu of any more labor-intensive search. 

3. Public Administrator’s Office Remains Disposal Records 
All records of disposal of remains of decedents by the ICSO Public Administrator’s Office as referenced at page 258 of the ICSO Policy Manual under section 334.2.8(c) (‘If the decedent appears to be indigenes and the Public Administrators Office is assuming the responsibility for the burial of the decedent, all of the decedent’s property being retained by the Coroner’s Office shall be released to the Public Administrators Office.”). Please include all records of property transfers as well as records of burials for indigent John or Jane Doe remains. This request seeks records from January 1, 2005, through January 1, 2021. 

4. Death Notification Records Pursuant to 334.2.3
Records of notifications by ICSO or the Coroner’s Office or a designee, pursuant to ICSO Policy 334.2.3 to any foreign consulate regarding a death handled by the ICSO or Coroner of any person: (a) believed to be a migrant and non-resident of Imperial County, California or another U.S. County; or (b) whose identified cannot be verified but who was identified as missing by a consular official. Please provide records for January 1, 2019 - January 1, 2021. 

5. Coroner Request Records Pursuant to 334.2.1
Any ICSO record showing the total number of Coroner Requests made by year which fall within subsections (a) (“unattended deaths”); (f) (“criminal or suspected criminal action”); (i) (“accident or injury”); (j); and/or (p) of Section 334.2.1 of ICSO’s Policy Manual for the years 2005-2021. 

Requester info: 
I make this request on behalf of Marni LaFleur, Associate Professor of Anthropology at University of San Diego. These records will be used for academic, non-commercial purposes. Bio here: https://www.sandiego.edu/directory/biography.php?profile_id=7039

Fee waiver request: 
Because these records are being sought for educational and academic purposes, we respectfully request a fee waiver. In the event fees are required, we agree to pay up to $25 without notification. If the total search and reproduction fees exceed $25, please notify us at MarniLaFleur@sandiego.edu and Andrew@detentionkills.org. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within the statutorily required period. 

If you have any questions regarding request, require additional information to fulfill, or would like to proposal an alternative production protocol, please contact us at MarniLaFleur@sandiego.edu and Andrew@detentionkills.org. 


Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Death Records  - Imperial County Sheriff’s Office
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following California Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Feb. 22, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: CPRA request for coroner records of Imperial County Sheriff's Office Our no. PRA022
communications.communication:
Please accept the following responses to the California Public Records Act request of the Imperial County Sheriff's Office:


1.       Please find attached the ICSO policy regarding Death Investigations. This is the only policy procedure or guidance document responsive to your request.

2.       There are no documents responsive to this request. ICSO does not keep documents listing by date or case no. reports for unidentified dead bodies.

3.       A request has been made by County Counsel of the Public Administrator's Office for the Remains Disposal records which thus far has not been responded to, so the Public Administrator seeks an additional fourteen days to file a response, assuming such records exist.

4.       ICSO doesn't document records of notifications to any foreign consulate regarding a death handled by ICSO; these  requested documents do not exist.

5.       ICSO does not generate reports nor keep separate records of the total number of Coroner Requests made by year which fall within the categories of unattended deaths or criminal or suspected action or accident or injury.


Deputy County Counsel Danuta Tuszynska

title: Tennessee DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: RE: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennessee DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc).

2) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Elijah Salisbury.

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: emails
communications.communication:
The Office of Court Administration acknowledges receipt of your FOIL request dated 1/5/23, seeking:

All emails sent by ex-Chief Judge Janet DiFiore from June 1, 2022, to the date that her resignation as Chief Judge became effective.

The portion of your request seeking "all emails sent by ex-Chief Judge Janet DiFiore from July 1, 2022, to the date that her resignation as Chief Judge became effective" is denied pursuant to Public Officers Law § 89(3) which requires a request for records to be "reasonably described." Your request seeks "all" records without reference to specific individuals or external parties, and lacks a specific subject matter or search terms; as such, it does not "reasonably describe" the records requested. See Public Officers Law § 89(3)(a). The Committee on Open Government has explained that "a request for 'all' records, without limitation, that include a certain name, for example, might not be found to reasonably describe the records." (COOG AO-18863 (April 5, 2012), COOG AO 18949 (Aug. 20, 2012)).

Please note, you submitted the same request previously and it was answered on 11/10/22 (attached).

Pursuant to Public Officers Law § 89(4)(a), you have thirty (30) days to take a written appeal of this determination.  You may appeal by writing:

Nancy J. Barry, Chief of Operations
FOIL Appeals Officer
25 Beaver Street, 11th Floor
New York, NY 10004

Or, you may submit such appeal by email to: FOILappeal@nycourts.gov<mailto:FOILappeal@nycourts.gov>

files.title: ~WRD0365
files.source: New York State Office of Court Administration, New York

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: emails
communications.communication:
Hello,

I am appealing the denial of my FOIL request for "All emails sent by ex-Chief Judge Janet DiFiore from July 1, 2022, to the date that her resignation as Chief Judge became effective."

In denying my FOIL request, OCA cited Public Officers Law § 89(3) and (COOG AO-18863 (April 5, 2012), COOG AO 18949 (Aug. 20, 2012)) to justify their determination that my request was overly broad and did not sufficiently describe the records requested.

Public Officers Law § 89(3) states that records must be "reasonably described," which my request was, specifically requesting emails sent by one employee of OCA during a roughly one-month period.

COOG AO 18949 (accessible at https://docsopengovernment.dos.ny.gov/coog/ftext/2013/18949.html) states that "agency staff are not required to engage in herculean or unreasonable efforts in locating records to accommodate a person seeking records." In that opinion, the request in question would have required combing through 3,000 emails to find the correspondence between two specific individuals over an unbounded time period.

That is not the case here. I am rather requesting the emails sent by one government employee over a one-month period.

COOG also noted that agencies have property denied "requests for all email communications transmitted or received by a particular government officer or employee over a period of several years, without regard to subject matter or content." Again, the scope of this request is far narrower.

OCA did not state that it would require unreasonable, or even particularly extensive, effort, to complete this request. In the opinion cited by OCA, COOG wrote: "When an agency has the ability to locate and identify records sought in conjunction with its filing, indexing and retrieval mechanisms, it was found that a request meets the requirement of reasonably describing the records, irrespective of the volume of the request."

I believe that OCA has the ability to locate and identify the emails sent by its former chief over a one-month period. Accordingly, my appeal should be granted.

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: emails
communications.communication:
Please find OCA’s determination on your appeal of this FOIL matter attached.
Kind regards,

Michael Siudzinski
Assistant Deputy Counsel
NYS Office of Court Administration
25 Beaver Street
New York, NY 10004

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: emails
communications.communication:
This e-mail responds to the FOIL appeal response dated 2/7/23 which remanded your request for:

All emails sent by ex-Chief Judge Janet DiFiore from June 1, 2022, to the date that her resignation as Chief Judge became effective.
Attached please find documents responsive to your request.

Please note, records that respond to your request are exempt from disclosure because they constitute "inter-agency or intra-agency materials" which are not: statistical or factual tabulations or data; instructions to staff that affect the public; final agency policy or determinations; or external audits. Public Officers Law § 87(2)(g).

Additionally, portions of the records that respond to your request are redacted or exempt from disclosure pursuant to Public Officers Law § 87(2)(b) because, if disclosed, would "constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy."

Finally, pursuant to Public Officers Law § 87(2)(a), an agency may deny access to records or portions thereof that are "specifically exempted from disclosure by state or federal statute." Accordingly, certain records responsive to your request are exempt from production pursuant to privilege under CPLR Article 3101 and CPLR Article 45.

Pursuant to Public Officers Law § 89(4)(a), you have thirty (30) days to take a written appeal of this determination.  You may appeal by writing:

Nancy J. Barry, Chief of Operations
FOIL Appeals Officer
25 Beaver Street, 11th Floor
New York, NY 10004

Or, you may submit such appeal by email to: FOILappeal@nycourts.gov<mailto:FOILappeal@nycourts.gov>

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. communications.communication:

02/22/2023 

Dimitrius Williams 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR140891 263 Huntington Ave 
Boston MA 02115 

Dear Dimitrius: 

RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N012352-021823 
Thank you again for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. 
Under the Freedom of Information Act, a public body may extend the time to respond to a FOIA request by up to 5 business days for a limited number of reasons. 5 ILCS 140/3(e). 
We are extending the time to respond to your request by 5 business days for one or more of the following reason(s): 
(  ) the requested records are stored in whole or in part at other locations than the office having charge of the requested records; 
( )  the request requires the collection of a substantial number of specified records; 
( ) the request is couched in categorical terms and requires an extensive search for the records responsive to it; 
( ) the requested records have not been located in the course of routine search and additional efforts are being made to locate them; 
(x) the requested records require examination and evaluation by personnel having the necessary competence and discretion to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of this Act or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions; 
(x) the request for records cannot be complied with by the public body within the time limits prescribed by 5 ILCS 140/3 (c) without unduly burdening or interfering with the operations of the public body; 
() there is need for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed, with another public body or among two or more components of a public body having a substantial interest in the determination or in the subject matter of the request. 

Sincerely, 

Patricia Majchrowicz 
FOIA Officer 
Chicago Public Schools 

Please note that District Offices were closed on Monday, February 20th in observance of Presidents' Day.

communications.communication:

03/08/2023 
Dimitrius Williams 
Dear Dimitrius: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N012352-021823 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Supply records sufficient to show a listing of incident reports and misconduct reports from September 2021 through June 15, 2022 the following school: 1. Reavis Math and Science Specialty School located at 834 E 50th, Chicago, IL Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment via excel spreadsheet or PDF. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Dimitrius Williams 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Funtitled-140891%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ1CCn_QB9jem9PQylx6L91s%3A1pTJbw%3AjVes61-Hp8KogKztqq5mjCu413HKnnvi1kfxhZQcado 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. 
Please be advised that certain event reasons have been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). 
5 ILCS 140/7(1)(c) exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy... “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 
Please also be advised that although the District does have an incident reporting database (Aspen) that is used to document incidents, it does not comprehensively track disciplinary/misconduct action against students. Although some student discipline is maintained in our incident reporting database,  it does not comprehensively track the information you appear to be seeking. For example, an entry showing a school code of conduct violation might not always result in disciplinary action. Additionally, the date that an incident was entered may not be the same date as when the discipline was issued. Furthermore, multiple students may be involved in a single incident report in various roles such as a participant or a witness. In order to determine if an incident report resulted in disciplinary action the District would have to read through each of the hundreds of incident reports submitted, reconcile them with various student records, some of which are kept at the school-level, and generate a new record that is not done in the normal course of business. However, please use this link and scroll down to “Suspension/Expulsion” to view similar data available on the District’s website: https://www.cps.edu/about/district-data/metrics/ Please note that the Illinois Freedom of Information Act applies to existing records only and public bodies are not required to compile data from multiple sources into a single record, or answer questions (See generally Hites v. Waubonsee Comm. College, Il App 2d, 150836 (2016)(... "requests went beyond a search for records—that is, the data in the databases—and instead improperly sought information about those records." quoting National Security Counselors v. Central Intelligence Agency, 898 F. Supp. 2d 233, 271 (D.D.C. 2012) and Chicago Tribune v. DFPR, IL App. (4th) 130437 at 8 (2014) ("[t]he Department was not obligated ... to answer plaintiff's "general inquiry question" concerning the number of initial claims since this would have required creating a new record.") 
You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: 
Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 Fax: 217-782-1396 E-mail: publicaccess@atg.state.il.us You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, 
Patricia Majchrowicz FOIA Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: DOD/DTRA 1.3.23

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DOD/DTRA 1.3.23
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

All contacting records responsive to Shield Analysis Technology LLC and Denise N. Baken (award IDs: HDTRA122C0024 and HDTRA121C0025). Shield Analysis Technology LLC was awarded contracts between Fiscal Years 2021 and 2022 with the Department of Defense (DOD) through its subsidiary agency, the Defense Threat Reduction Agency. This request includes, but is not limited to:

- Current and previous contracts

- Requests for Proposals

- Initial Bid Documents

- Memorandum(s) of Understanding

- Letters of Interest

- Privacy impact assessments

- Invoices

- Change Orders

- Presentations by Shield Analysis Technology LLC or Denise N. Baken

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media, with bylines including Covert Action Magazine, Janata Weekly, and Philly Voice. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.
