title: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – BODY WORN CAMERAS (Sacramento Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – BODY WORN CAMERAS (Sacramento Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request the following information from your office for the period January 1, 2020 to the date of this letter.

 - Number, if any, of Body Worn Cameras owned by this department or agency, including the manufacturer and whether a data storage package has been provided by the manufacturer.

 - Any documents or correspondence during the period encompassing this request regarding possible or planned acquisition of Body Warn Cameras.

 - Any existing or proposed usage policies regarding the use of Body Worn Cameras  including protocols, training documents, data storage procedures and prohibited activities.

 - Any current or past litigation involving or referencing this department or agency involving the use of Body Worn Cameras.


Please notify me when this information is available.

Thank you for your attention to this request and for your prompt reply within 10 days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Swartz Day Police Surveillance Project

title: Request for Your Agency's 2022 Roster & Salary Data (Delmar Police Department)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2022 Roster & Salary Data (Delmar Police Department)
RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2022 Roster & Salary Data (Delmar Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Maryland Public Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Feb. 22, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Request for Your Agency's 2022 Roster & Salary Data (Delmar Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

It is our intention to gather and provide the information requested. That being said I do not have administrative staff and must research this information myself, while still handling my day to day duties. I am trying to complete this task at no cost to you, as requested.

I would note that the law says I must provide the requested information for your review and copy. It does not state that it must be done
in a particular format or media.

Again I will gather that information and make it available to you by 03/10/2023 at the latest.

title: Texas Freedom of Information Act. Request: Texas Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University Of North Texas System)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas Freedom of Information Act. Request: Texas Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University Of North Texas System)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Texas Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

title: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (Spokane County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (Spokane County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Welcome to the Spokane County Public Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Spokane County Public Records Center! 
 
Your Login ID is:  140301-58410314@requests.muckrock.com

communications.subject: Sheriff Public Records Request :: S012297-020923
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Spokane County. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was received in this office on 2/9/2023 and given the reference number S012297-020923 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fspokane-county-sheriffs-office-561%252Fpolice-staff-roster-february-2023-spokane-county-sheriffs-office-140301%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAwLMyQ_gKHxZfHlysTK9ujJ1s%3A1pQKHY%3AeboCVjl5mJrY5Bgycp04BdC_k1UWEHKvvyfOberH_Ts 
Not all public documents are available in electronic format. If the document(s) requested are not available electronically, we will make them available for inspection or by paper copy in accordance with the Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Please be advised that Spokane Regional Emergency Communications ("SREC") is the custodian of 911 and Crime Check audio recordings as well as audio recordings of dispatch and radio traffic. If you are attempting to obtain audio recordings of 911/Crime Check calls and/or radio traffic, you need to submit a separate request to SREC directly. You can submit a records request to SREC via their website, 
Spokane County

Specifically, you requested: “To Whom It May Concern:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fspokane-county-sheriffs-office-561%252Fpolice-staff-roster-february-2023-spokane-county-sheriffs-office-140301%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAwLMyQ_gKHxZfHlysTK9ujJ1s%3A1pQKHY%3AeboCVjl5mJrY5Bgycp04BdC_k1UWEHKvvyfOberH_Ts” 
We reasonably anticipate an installment/requested records will be available on or before March 10, 2023. If public records become available in advance of this estimate, we will let you know. Conversely, if staff encounters a need to extend our estimate, we will advise accordingly. 
With respect to audio recordings, please be advised that Spokane Regional Emergency Communications ("SREC") is the custodian of 911/Crime Check audio recordings as well as audio recordings of radio traffic. If you are attempting to obtain audio recordings of 911/Crime Check calls and/or radio traffic, you need to submit a separate request to SREC directly via the following link: https://srec911.com/ 
Finally, please be advised that there may be fees associated with the copying of public records. Please take a moment to  familiarize yourself with Spokane County's Public Records Request Policy and Fee Schedule, which can be found in the FAQs section. 
Sincerely, 
JOHN F. NOWELS, Sheriff 
Spokane County 
Tiffany Kinnick 
Public Records Officer

Specifically, you requested: “To Whom It May Concern:

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fspokane-county-sheriffs-office-561%252Fpolice-staff-roster-february-2023-spokane-county-sheriffs-office-140301%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAwLMyQ_gKHxZfHlysTK9ujJ1s%3A1pQKHY%3AeboCVjl5mJrY5Bgycp04BdC_k1UWEHKvvyfOberH_Ts” 
The responsive records are now available for download in the “My Request Center” of the public records portal. Instructions for downloading the files follows:  
  * Navigate to the Spokane County Public Records Center by following the blue "Public Records Center" hyperlink contained in the footer of this email. 
  * Log in with your user name and password. You will be taken directly into this request. 
  * Click on the "Download All" button directly above the blue "Files" box. *If you have a pop-up blocker, you will need to allow pop-ups for this site in order for the files to download. After they have downloaded, if the files do not open automatically, they will appear in your computer's "Downloads" folder. 
The Spokane County Sheriff's Office is obligated to provide records in accordance with the Washington State Public Records Act. Please note that the records you have requested may contain images and/or descriptions of events that are considered graphic in nature and may not be suitable for children or those who are sensitive to such material. 
No additional responsive records were located. This is the Spokane County Sheriff’s Office final and definitive response to this request. This request is considered closed. PLEASE NOTE: If you want to pick up printed copies of the records from the Public Safety Building, you must call 509-477-6926 at least one business day before you plan to arrive so that we can have the records ready for you. Depending on the number of pages, printing charges may apply. 
Sincerely, 
JOHN F. NOWELS, Sheriff 
Spokane County 
Tiffany Kinnick 
Public Records Officer

title: Subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Copy of 2021-2022 CIC Health contract

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Copy of 2021-2022 CIC Health contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copy of the contract with CIC Health for COVID testing services for the 2021-2022 school year.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Tracey

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Laughing Planet Reno, NV Food Establishment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all food establishment inspection reports for the restaurant Laughing Planet at 650 Tahoe St, Reno, NV 89509, from 2019-2022

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Victor Ledezma

communications.subject: Town of Elkton, Maryland
communications.communication:
We received a letter with a code to upload, however the code given was not recognized.  PPJGRURX was declined.

Going forward all PIA request need to be accompanied by our Freedom of Information Request.  I have attached that form, please use it in the future.

Thank you!

Respectfully,

Renee McCormick
HR Benefits Specialist
Human Resources
Town of Elkton
100 Railroad Avenue
P.O. Box 157
Elkton, MD  21922
